result.execSummary:
The defendant William Harden Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Harden Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Harden Jr was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc. [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).
  • William Harden Jr was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SH, SL or GALH.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Chandra H., G.A.H and B.J.H.

- Defendant shall not be at 500 Block of Clara St., Sun Prairie
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

- The Court finds sustantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8 p.m. and 6 a.m., unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- Defendant must reside at 6201 Sandsnes Ln, Madison
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $ 10,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail or bond is co-signed, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is review by the court.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 2

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Andrea B Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
